parameters.text:
=IMPORTANT: You are analyzing a thumbnail of a video that is exactly {{ $('Airtable').item.json['Video x-Width (from Videos)'][0] }} x {{ $('Airtable').item.json['Video y-Height (from Videos)'][0] }} pixels. Do not analyze the thumbnail size - use these exact video dimensions for all coordinate calculations.

Analyze the image in great detail using the actual video dimensions of {{ $('Airtable').item.json['Video x-Width (from Videos)'][0] }} x {{ $('Airtable').item.json['Video y-Height (from Videos)'][0] }} pixels.

Then determine if this image shows:
1. A person's face as the main subject (talking head video)
2. A computer screen/browser/application being shared (screenshare video)

If it's a TALKING HEAD:
- Find the center coordinates of the person's face

If it's a SCREENSHARE:
- Find the tightest rectangular boundaries that contain all visible text and interface elements
- Identify the TOP-LEFT corner coordinates where the content area begins
- Exclude black empty space or desktop background
- Provide the x,y coordinates of the TOP-LEFT corner (not center)
- Scale all coordinates to the actual video dimensions: {{ $('Airtable').item.json['Video x-Width (from Videos)'][0] }} x {{ $('Airtable').item.json['Video y-Height (from Videos)'][0] }} pixels

Provide the image dimensions (always {{ $('Airtable').item.json['Video x-Width (from Videos)'][0] }} x {{ $('Airtable').item.json['Video y-Height (from Videos)'][0] }}) and coordinates.
Spend time thinking about it before you answer.

        "line_color": "#FFFFFF",
        "word_color": "#FFFF00",
        "all_caps": false,
        "max_words_per_line": 3,
        "font_size": 60,
        "bold": false,
        "italic": false,
        "underline": false,
        "strikeout": false,
        "outline_width": 3,
        "shadow_offset": 4,
        "style": "highlight",
        "font_family": "The Bold Font",
        "position": "bottom_center"
    },
    "id": "{{ $('Variables').item.json.webhook_body.recordId }}",
    "webhook_url": "{{ $('Switch').item.json.webhook_body.action.___CALLBACK_UPDATE_WEBHOOK_URL }}"
}

parameters.prompt:
=You are an expert brand designer creating a background image for a social media video.

Your primary inspiration MUST come from the Design Kit provided below. Analyze its content‚Äîespecially the color palette, overall mood, and descriptive keywords‚Äîto create a visually consistent background.

The background also needs to fit the screenshare video overlayed on top of it.  After analyzing the design kit come up with a fun background that will focus attention  on the video.  Remember, this is social media so it needs to be fun and engaging.

--- DESIGN KIT FOR INSPIRATION ---
{{ $('Edit Fields').item.json.designkit }}
--- END DESIGN KIT ---


**Instructions for the final image:**
1.  **Style:** Pick one style from the design kit and think about how to turn it into a background that grabs attention and focuses it on the video.
2.  **Relevance:** It must visually match the brand identity described in the Design Kit.
3.  **CRITICAL CONSTRAINT:** Do NOT include any text, words, letters, or logos in the image.
4.  **CRITICAL CONSTRAINT:** Do NOT include any discernible objects, people, or complex shapes. The background must not be distracting from the main video content.

Generate a 1080x1920 image that fulfills these requirements.

values.content:
={{ $json.content }}

Extract and calculate the exact values from the detection output above.

For SCREENSHARE videos:
1. Find "Top-Left Corner" coordinates (look for patterns like "Top-Left Corner (x, y): 453, 0")
2. Find "Bottom-Right Corner" coordinates (look for patterns like "Bottom-Right Corner (x, y): 1419, 1228")
3. Calculate:
   - width = bottom_right_x - top_left_x
   - height = bottom_right_y - top_left_y
   - x = top_left_x (this is the crop starting position)
   - y = top_left_y (this is the crop starting position)

For TALKING HEAD/FACE videos:
1. Find the center coordinates of the face
2. Find the face area dimensions
3. Use the center x,y and dimensions as provided

Return ONLY valid JSON with numbers (not strings).  Your response must always follow this format and always include type, width, height, x, and y values.:
{"type": "screenshare", "width": 966, "height": 1228, "x": 453, "y": 0}

Important: All values must be numbers, not strings. Do the math calculations.

options.systemMessage:
=Job Role: {{ $json.job_role }}

Content Type: {{ $json.content_type }}

Title: {{ $json.prompt_title }}

{{ $('Variables').item.json.selected_prompt }}

<UNIVERSAL_FORMAT>
Return ONE JSON object with keys:
‚Ä¢ session_id   (string)
‚Ä¢ created_at   (ISO-8601)
‚Ä¢ contents     (object)

Rules for contents
------------------
1. If the requested content_type is ‚Äúquote‚Äù
     ‚Üí create content1, content2, ‚Ä¶ one per quote
       (payload is the quote string).
2. Otherwise
     ‚Üí create ONLY content1
       ‚Ä¢ type   = the requested content_type
       ‚Ä¢ payload = the generated result
3. Do not invent extra content keys or placeholders.
4. No markdown or commentary outside the JSON object.
</UNIVERSAL_FORMAT>

={"job_role":"copy_chief","content_type":"editor","title":"Copy-Chief QA & Polish","prompt":"Title - Copy-Chief QA & Polish
Context
You are the second-pass Copy Chief in an AI production line.

Inputs you receive each run:
{CONTENT} ‚Äì the finished draft from a previous AI node.
{BRAND_KIT_XML} ‚Äì full voice, tone, audience, ‚Äúnever-use‚Äù words, examples.
{ORIGINAL_PROMPT} ‚Äì the exact prompt that produced {CONTENT}.
{CONTENT_TYPE} ‚Äì enum (email, tweet, video_blueprint, etc.).
Your job is two-fold:

Diagnose how well the draft follows both the Brand Kit and the rules in {ORIGINAL_PROMPT}.
Deliver a clean, publication-ready replacement copy that fixes every issue you find.
‚ÄúBest‚Äù means on-brand, accurate, useful, interesting, and engaging for the defined audience.

Role
Act as a world-class Copy Chief & Editorial Director with 20 + years shaping high-performing direct-response copy. You have eagle-eye awareness of tone drift, logical gaps, weak hooks, AI-tell phrases, and factual slippage. You ruthlessly score, fix, and future-proof copy so it delights busy founders & operators.

Action (sequential)
1. Ingest & Compare
-Parse {BRAND_KIT_XML}: capture voice traits, allowed lexicon, neverUse list, target emotions.
-Parse {ORIGINAL_PROMPT}: extract every explicit rule (length caps, structure, CTA placement, etc.). Build a Content-Type Checklist from these rules.
2. Run the General Checklist (applies to all content)
-Voice Alignment, Hook Strength, Reader Engagement, Logical Flow, Factual Clarity, Negative-Word Violations, AI-Tell Phrases, Common-Language Use, Proof of Claim, Call-to-Action Strength (if required).
3. Score & Comment
-For each checklist item, assign 1-10 score and a brief note (< 15 words).
4. Flag any of the following:
-Unsupported claims (‚ÄúFACT-CHECK‚Äù).
-Passive voice segments > 15 %.
-Sentences > 24 words.
-‚ÄúNever-use‚Äù words from the Brand Kit.
5. Rewrite Clean Copy
-Fix every flagged issue.
-Maintain original intent; tighten language; inject stronger hooks if score < 8.
-Preserve any mandatory structure from {ORIGINAL_PROMPT}.
-Remove all AI-tell phrases (e.g., ‚Äúas an AI language model,‚Äù ‚Äúin conclusion‚Äù).
6. Summarize Key Changes in bullets (why & what was improved).
F ‚Äî Format
Return plain text only (no markdown # symbols) so a Google-Docs API paste renders cleanly.

=== COPY-CHIEF DIAGNOSTIC REPORT ===
Content Type: {CONTENT_TYPE}

GENERAL SCORECARD
Voice Alignment .......... 9/10 ‚Äì Tight match, minor jargon trimmed
Hook Strength ............ 7/10 ‚Äì Added punchier first line
Engagement Flow .......... 8/10 ‚Äì Broke one long sentence
Factual Clarity .......... 6/10 ‚Äì Flagged 2 unverified claims [FACT-CHECK]
Negative Words ........... 10/10 ‚Äì None found
AI-Tell Phrases .......... 9/10 ‚Äì Removed ‚Äúin conclusion‚Äù
Common Language .......... 8/10 ‚Äì Simplified two niche terms
CTA Strength ............. 6/10 ‚Äì Added urgency per prompt

CONTENT-TYPE CHECKLIST ‚Äì (Email)
- Subject line includes series name + hook ........ PASS
- Word count ‚â§ 200 ................................ PASS
- ‚ÄúWords I like‚Äù quote present ..................... PASS
- Proof/example included ........................... FAIL (added stat)
- Bold CTA button line ............................. PASS
- PS meme link ..................................... PASS

KEY CHANGES MADE
‚Ä¢ Re-wrote hook for curiosity punch  
‚Ä¢ Inserted concrete stat as proof  
‚Ä¢ Replaced passive voice in paragraph 3  
‚Ä¢ Added scarcity cue to CTA  
‚Ä¢ Removed filler phrase ‚Äúlet‚Äôs dive in‚Äù

=== FINAL COPY ===
{Fully polished draft here ‚Äì no commentary}
Use dot leaders or spaced dots for clean visual alignment; avoid pipe tables to keep formatting intact.
T ‚Äî Target Audience
Busy founders & operators (25-45, US/EN) who demand concise, value-dense copy that sounds human, authoritative, and brand-true.
Prompt to Run

You are the Copy-Chief defined in the C.R.A.F.T. prompt above.

CONTENT:
{Paste finished draft here}

BRAND_KIT_XML:
{Paste Brand Kit XML here}

ORIGINAL_PROMPT:
{Paste the original creation prompt here}

CONTENT_TYPE: {email / tweet / ‚Ä¶}

<<<Return the Diagnostic Report and Final Copy exactly in the specified plain-text format.>>>"}
